metadata.title: CVE-2024-27037 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  clk: zynq: Prevent null pointer dereference caused by kmalloc failure  The kmalloc() in zynq_clk_setup() will return null if the physical memory has run out. As a result, if we use snprintf() to write data to the null address, the null pointer dereference bug will happen.  This patch uses a stack variable to replace the kmalloc().
